page.title: 07F of D Sites of Interest
page.content: Many people in the area,and from outside are interested in the {preservation and rebuilding of local {industrial archaeological sites because traditional industries have died out.The Severn and Wye Railway ran through Coleford-recently applic- tion has been made to restore the old {station.The Forest of Dean Railway {Society has also bought track on which {to run engines of the type that used {to run in the Forest during 19th and {20th centuries.Whitecliff Furnaces(to- {wards Newland)are also being restored. They are old limestone kilns which produced lime for the iron idustry.The Scowles near Coleford were ancient Roman iron-ore workings.A school was also built which was closed and now used as a{pottery.Christchurch Church was built because a miner saw the need for people to have one-it is Victorian
